column2: By the side of a wood, in a country a long way off, ran a fine stream of water; and upon the stream there stood a mill.
column3: By the side of a wood, in a country a long way off, ran a fine stream of water; and upon the stream there stood a mill.

column2: And round about the wheel went merrily; the work was quickly done, and the straw was all spun into gold.
column3: And round about the wheel went merrily; the work was quickly done, and the straw was all spun into gold.

column2: When the king came and saw this, he was greatly astonished and pleased; but his heart grew still more greedy of gain, and he shut up the poor miller's daughter again with a fresh task.
column3: When the king came and saw this, he was greatly astonished and pleased; but his heart grew still more greedy of gain, and he shut up the poor miller's daughter again with a fresh task.

column2: till, long before morning, all was done again.
column3: till, long before morning, all was done again.

column2: At the birth of her first little child she was very glad, and forgot the dwarf, and what she had said.
column3: At the birth of her first little child she was very glad, and forgot the dwarf, and what she had said.
